{"step_by_step_thinking": "Hemoglobin is a protein in red blood cells that carries oxygen from the lungs to the body's tissues and returns carbon dioxide from the tissues back to the lungs. It does not have any antimicrobial properties. Antimicrobial substances are those that kill or inhibit the growth of microorganisms such as bacteria, fungi, or protozoans.", "answer_choice": "B. no"}
